transportAdvice: Beijing has an extensive metro network that connects most major tourist sites, making it easy and affordable to get around without a car. Buses also cover the city widely, taxis are readily available, and walking is practical within individual neighborhoods though distances between major attractions can be large.

weather.description: Cold, dry winter month with occasional snow and clear skies; heavy layers are essential.
Still cold and dry with winds picking up; conditions begin to slowly improve toward month end.
Spring begins but sandstorms from the north are common; temperatures rise but winds can be strong.
Pleasant spring weather with warming temperatures, though dust and wind remain possible.
Warm and increasingly comfortable, one of the better months to visit before summer heat arrives.
Hot and humid with occasional thunderstorms; outdoor sightseeing is best done in the morning.
Peak summer heat with the highest rainfall of the year; expect frequent heavy downpours.
Still hot and rainy with high humidity; conditions similar to July but gradually easing late in the month.
Autumn arrives with cooler, clearer days and reduced rainfall; one of the best months to visit.
Crisp, clear autumn weather with beautiful foliage; very popular travel season with larger crowds.
Temperatures drop quickly and the air turns dry and cold; early snowfall is possible by month end.
Cold winter month with dry air and occasional snow; wrap up warmly for outdoor sightseeing.
